Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum scored 37 points as the Boston Celtics launched the defense of their NBA crown with an emphatic 132-109 defeat of the New York Knicks on Tuesday.

Boston powered to last season's NBA championship after winning 64 games in the regular season before dropping just three games in the playoffs, sealing victory with a 4-1 rout of the Dallas Mavericks in the NBA Finals.
Pre-Game Insights: Jayson Tatum told the crowd, 'Let's enjoy this moment together. I can honestly say, to the best fans in the world â€” let's do it again.'
The Celtics have retained the core of the team from last season's roster and look well-positioned to mount a serious defense of their title.
Post-Match Reflections: Tatum finished with 10 assists and four rebounds in addition to his 37 points.
Jalen Brunson led the Knicks scoring with 22 points, alongside Miles McBride with 22 from the bench.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game took place at TD Garden in Boston.
The Celtics raised their record-breaking 18th championship banner before the game.
Others: The Celtics' starting lineup consisted of Jayson Tatum, Jaylen Brown, Derrick White, Jrue Holiday, and Al Horford.
The Knicks finished the game with a record of 0-1.
